content:
I do not ever recall there being an email.comcast.net mail server.

Incoming POP accounts use mail.comcast.net but that is for incoming mail not outgoing.

The SMTP server name for comcast is given by them as smtp.comcast.net See https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/email-client-programs-with-xfinity-email
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Last I heard the update rate for existing installations was set to zero. the only ones getting the new version being those that downloaded it.

BTW I have no idea what that image has to do with what you wrote. Did you perhaps post the wrong file?

I do not rely on the computer to make decisions for me, I look at the data and facts myself like this https://github.com/thunderbird/import-export-tools-ng/issues/600 SO the import export tools update is imminent.

this qnote has a similar issue https://github.com/mlazdans/qnote/issues/54 without a response from the author in the whole 19 hour since the issue was raised. You might want to follow that issue as it is raised where it might get a response.

Note++ which qnote purports to expand the feature set of is compatible with V128. Is it some expanded feature you need or an addon that works?

Note there is NO opt-out of Thunderbird update checking.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
My name is not Jon, nor as far as I can determine from your past postings in this forum has that been the name of anyone you have interacted with.

Perhaps you have already posted there as the moderation guy is Jon.

content:
Ok, you have used 89% of the space allocated to you7 by your mail provider, whomever that is. You do not mention who your account is with.

If you want more space with them I am sure they will sell it to you for a recurring fee.

just to save some time Google details here https://support.google.com/drive/answer/2375123?hl=en&co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop and https://support.google.com/drive/answer/9312312?hl=en&ref_topic=14940&sjid=16887865350827281525-AP hotmail/live/msn/outlook in it's many guises https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/outlook_com/forum/all/how-to-increase-storage-space-on-outlookcom/662fcafd-ea45-4b19-9f94-5fecd8294764

Yahoo I will not bother with as they apparently offer a terabyte of storage. So I do not think that will be your mail ever
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Have you cleared out the users system temp folder? I suggest that as a starting point.
